English: Karela has his day
Sabziwala
Amma, the vegetable vendor is here
It was  Sanju's and Gaurav's grand-uncle who was on a visit.
Sanskrit: सञ्जोः गौरवस्य च प्रमातुलः दर्शने आगतवान्।

English: Eeek! What was that? A lizard?
No, no. It is only my karela.
Karela? Yikes! I thought it was just a lizard.
Sanskrit: कारवेलः? हन्त! केवलं गोधिका इति मतवान् अहम्।

English: What is all this commotion?
When the boys had explained -
Oh, yes! I quite forgot mamaji has a revulsion for karelas...but then your father likes them so much.
Sanskrit: आम्! विस्मृतम् यत् प्रमातुलः कारवेलं द्वेष्टि। किन्तु पित्रे बहु रोचते।

English: What's a revulsion?
Well..he..just hates karelas-he can't tolerate them..that's all.
Thimma! Buy a kilo please.
Re..re..revulsion for karelas? That sounds like fun, doesn't it. Gaurav?
Sanskrit: कारवेलं द्वे..द्वे..द्वेष्टि इति किम्? रोचकम् भाति किल गौरव?

English: It sure does. Sanju.
Can we borrow a Karela, Thimma?
Sure, Sanju
Why is mamaji scared of this harmless thing, Sanju?
Sanskrit: किमर्थं प्रमातुलः अस्मात् निरपायात् वस्तोः बिभेति, सञ्जो?

English: I don't know! Come on. Let's play with it.
Has that Sabziwala left?
Yes, yes. mamaji.
What is that you're playing catch with?
A..A..Kar..
A Karela? Yikes! Get rid of it at once.
Sanju! Gaurav! Didn't tell you mamaji doesn't like karelas? Now be good boys and put it away?
Sanskrit: सञ्जो! गौरव! कारवेलाः प्रमातुलाय न रोचन्ते इति पूर्वं कथितं किल? साधू बालौ भूत्वा कारवेलं पृथक्कुरुतम्।

English: Okay, we will put it away amma.
Good!
We will plant this in mamaji's coat pocket.
That will be fun.
Mamaji, gaurav, Sanju! come! Tea is ready.
Sanskrit: मातुल! गौरव! सञ्जो! आगच्छत! चाय-पानं सिद्धम्।

English: Come, come, let us hurry!
Now, wait and watch.
So, what've you been up to, you naughty boys?
No..nothing in particular mamaji.
Have some pakodas, children.
Thimma, Please answer the door.
yes, amma.
Soon-
Who is it?
It is Malla, Mr. Raman's servant boy..
He says when mamaji met Mr. Ramanin the park yesterday, mamaji had promised to give him a formula for slimming.
Sanskrit: सः वदति यत् प्रमातुलः यदा रामन-वर्येण लोकोद्याने ह्यः अमिलत् प्रमातुलः रामन-वर्याय कृशकरणस्य सूत्रं दास्यामि इति वचनम् दत्तवान्।

English: Oh! That impatient Raman! I told him I'd give it to him this evening.
Sanskrit: अरे! ईयत् अधैर्यं! सायङ्काले दास्यामि इति कथितं मया।

English: Anyway, if he is in a such hurry, I will send it right away. Thimma, you will find it in the right side pocket of my coat.
Sanskrit: अस्तु! त्वरा चेत्, शीघ्रमेव प्रेषयामि। तिम्म, मम प्रावारकस्य दक्षिण-कोषे अस्ति।

English: Yes, mamaji.
Urk! The kar..
Sometime later-
Come, let's go in and see if the karela's still there.
Sanskrit: आगच्छ, कारवेल्लः अधुनापि अस्ति वा न वा द्रक्ष्यावः।

English: Hey! It is not here.
Timma must have taken it out.
I'll answer it.
Mr. Raman returns this formula with his compliments.
What is it thimma?
Mr. Raman has just returned Mamaji's formula for slimming.
But why'd you give him this karela?
Well, mamaji had asked me to give this formula that was in his right side coat pocket.
Sanskrit: प्रमातुलः एव उक्तवान् किल? प्रावारकस्य दक्षिण-कोषे स्थितं सूत्रं देहि इति?

English: And all I found in his coat pocket was this. So I thought this was the formula! Why? Did I make a mistake?
Sanskrit: तत्र तु इदम् एव लब्धम्। अतएव इदमेव सूत्रम् इति मतवान् अहम्। किमर्थं पृच्छसि? दोषः जातः वा?

English: No, no, you did the right thing.
Anyway, give me back the formu..er..karela - I will put it back in mamaji's coat pocket.
Sanskrit: अस्तु! सूत्रम्..अर्थात्..कारवेल्लं प्रतिदेहि। प्रमातुलस्य प्रावारकस्य कोषे पुनः स्थापयामि।

English: And you tell him that Mr. Raman has returned the formula?
Sanskrit: अपिच रामन-वर्यं सूत्रं प्रतिदत्तवान् इति तं वदतु।

English: Okay
Mamaji! Er..Mr. Raman has returned the formula.
Already? Well, Put it back where you found it.
Sanskrit: इयत् शीघ्रम्? अस्तु यतः गृहीतं तत्रैव स्थापय।

English: I have.
Good.
Our Karela's really having a fine adventure!
Sanskrit: अस्मदीयं कारवेल्लं तु सम्यक् विहरत् अस्ति।

English: Yes, but the fun has not started yet. Wait till Mamaji puts on his coat.
Sanskrit: आम्, किन्तु विनोदम् अधुना अपि न आरभत। प्रमातुलः प्रावारकं धर्तुं प्रतीक्षस्व।

English: just then
Gaurav! Sanju! Game for a walk?
Of course.
Come on. Let us go.
Gaurava, Fetch my coat will you?
Of course, mamaji.
And soon they were on their way.
Sanskrit: तथा शीघ्रमेव ते सर्वे गच्छमानाः बभूवुः।

English: Be careful, Mamaji. The park is infested with thieves, esp., Bhimu and gang.
Sanskrit: भ्रमणे जागरुकतास्तु, प्रमातुल! उद्याने चोराः सन्ति, विषेशतः भीमु-गणस्य।

English: Don't worry, beti.
We're safe with mamaji around.
soon
Ah! Bhimu, here comes an old man with two boys.
Sanskrit: अरे, भीमो अत्र कश्चन वृद्धः बालाभ्यां सह आगच्छन् अस्ति।

English: Hey, what is that?
Just a mouse.
M..Mouse.
SSH! Come off it, Bhimu. A tough man like you can't be scared of mice?
Sanskrit: ष्ष्ष्! अलम् एव! त्वया सदृशः दृढ-नरः मूषकात् न बिभीहि।

English: I can face ten tigers but mice? Yikes!
Sanskrit: दश-व्याघ्रान् सम्मुखीकर्तुं शक्नोमि किन्तु मूषाकान्? हन्त!

English: SSH! They are closer now.
Hands up!
Hand over whatever you are carrying.
Search him, Bhimu. I will hold the kids.
Sanskrit: आशरीरे अन्वेषणं कुरु, भीमो। बालौ गृह्णामि।

English: Okay.
Hey, what is wrong?
Run-run!
W-Why?
Rats! Rats in his pocket.
What? Rats in my pocket? Let me see
AH! I found it.
Here it is.
What? A karela?
Yikes.
Run, boys. Run!
Later
You naughty boys had no business to plant that karela in my pocket.
Sanskrit: दुष्ट-बालौ! मम कोषे कारवेल्लं स्थापयित्वा अनुचितम् कृतम्।

English: But Mamaji you must admit that it saved us from the thieves.
Sanskrit: किन्तु प्रमातुल! मन्तव्यं यत् सः कारवेल्लः चोराभ्यां अस्मान् अरक्षत्।

English: Well, that I must. Thanks anyway, Karela. Even though I dislike you.
Sanskrit: अवश्यमेव! धन्यवादः कारवेल्ल! त्वयि द्वेषे सत्यपि।

English: Meet the horse.
50 million years ago, horses were small creatures found on the american continent.
Sanskrit: पञ्चकोटि-वत्सरेभ्यः पूर्वं अश्वाः लघु-पशवः ये अमेरिका-महाद्वीपे लब्धाः आसन्।

English: They were hunted by bigger animals.
Sanskrit: बृहत्तराः पशवः तेषां खेटनं कुर्वन्तः आसन्।

English: But they could run swiftly and usually managed to escape unhurt.
Sanskrit: किन्तु वेग-धावनेन, विना व्रणेन, भूयिष्ठेन ते पलायितवन्तः।

English: Over the centuries horses changed and evolved into the horses we know today.
Sanskrit: गतासु बह्वीषु शताब्दीषु अश्वाः परिवर्तिताः उद्विकसिताः जाताः यथा ते अद्य सन्ति।

English: But they could still run fast.
When the plains of north america grew bitterly cold, the horses migrated across the bering straits into asia.
Sanskrit: उत्तर-अमेरिकायाः भू-क्षेत्रेषु यदा तीव्र-शैत्यम् संजातं तदा अश्वाः बेरिङ्-जलडमरूमध्य-मार्ग-द्वारा जम्बू-द्वीपे स्थानन्तरम् अकुर्वन्।

English: In the cool, northern lands of Eurasia, pastures were plentiful.
Heavy horse breeds developed here.
Clydesdales, shires, percheron and suffolks are some of the heavy horse breeds.
Sanskrit: क्लैड्स्डेल्सः, षैर्सः, पेर्चेरोनः, सफोल्क्सः च काश्चन घनाः अश्वा-जातयः सन्ति।

English: They are tall and strong and their hooves are covered with hair.
In the hotter lands, pastures were few.
So horses remained smaller, but were lighter and swifter.
Sanskrit: अतएव अश्वाः लघुतराः किन्तु अल्पभाराः वेगतराः च।

English: Their descendants are the arabian horses of today.
For over 5000 years horses have served man loyally.
Sanskrit: पञ्चसहस्रात् अधिकान् वर्षान् यावत् अश्वाः मानवजातेः सेवाम् निष्ठया अकुर्वन्।

English: As pack animals they have carried heavy loads on their backs.
Sanskrit: भार-वाहक-पशु-रूपेण ते स्वीय-पृष्ठेषु महतः भारान् वहन्तः आसन्।

English: They have drawn ploughs.
They have even accompanied man when he went hunting.
Man could travel at incredible speeds on horseback.
For horses can travel over 48 kmph.
Sanskrit: यतोहि अश्वाः प्रतिहोराम् अष्टचत्वारिंशत्-किमिमितात्-दूरम् गन्तुं शक्नुवन्ति।

English: Horses were harnessed to carts and carriages - some light and small, others large and heavy.
Sanskrit: अश्वाः अल्पभार-लघुभिः वा भार-युक्त-महद्भिः शकटैः वाहनैः च युज्यन्ते स्म।

English: Now journeys became quicker and more comfortable.
Wars long ago were simple affairs.
Two armies fought hand-to-hand.
The entry of the horse on the battlefield changed all that.
Sanskrit: युद्ध-भूम्याम् अश्वस्य उपयोगेन युद्धनीतौ परिवर्तनं सञ्जातम्।

English: Soldiers, mounted on horse-back, could move swiftly and fight more complex and decisive battles.
Sanskrit: अश्वारूढाः सैनिकाः वेगेन सञ्चारं कर्तुं वा इतोऽपि असरलानि निर्णायकानि युद्धानि योद्धुं वा अशक्नुवन्।

English: Then the motor engine was invented and the horse was no longer as useful to man as before.
Sanskrit: अनन्तरं यन्त्रस्य आविष्काराद् अश्वस्य मानवजात्यै उपयोगिता पूर्वस्य अपेक्षया न्यूना जाता।

English: But, strangely enough, in recent years, the world's horse population has increased.
Sanskrit: किन्तु वैचित्रेण अद्यतन-काले विश्वस्मिन् अश्वस्य सङ्ख्या वर्धिता जाता।

English: Horses are bred at stud farms.
When a foal is born, he can see and walk.
Sanskrit: यदा अश्वशावकस्य जन्म भवति तदा सः शावकः द्रष्टुं चलितुं शक्नोति।

English: Within hours he will run into the fields.
Sanskrit: जन्मात् होरासु सः शावकः क्षेत्रे धावितुं शक्नोति।

English: At first he will nibble at this mother's food, soon he will be fed hay, bran and oats.
Sanskrit: आरम्भे सः मातुः भोजनं निष्कुषति, अचिरात् परम् घास-तृणानि गोधूम-कण्डनं करम्भं च स्वीकरोति।

English: He will need plenty of water.
As he grows older, the foal will have his own stable box.
Sanskrit: यदा सः वयोधिकः भविष्यति तदा तस्मै अश्व-स्थाने स्वीय-कक्षः दीयते।

English: Its floor will be covered with straw.
A blanket or a light sheet will keep him warm when it is cold.
Soon his training will begin.
Sanskrit: अचिरात् परं तस्य प्रशिक्षणस्य प्रारम्भः आरभ्यते।

English: He will be taught to walk slowly, to trot, to canter and gallop.
Sanskrit: शैनैः चलितुं, शीघ्रतया चलितुं, शैनैः धावितुं, शीघ्रतया धावितुं च प्रशिक्षितः भविष्यति।

English: Then it will be time to sell him for vast sums of money.
Sanskrit: तत् पश्चात् बहुधनार्थं तस्य विक्रयणं भविष्यति।

English: What will he be used for?
Horse-racing...
or he may be used to play polo, a ball game played on horse-back..
or as a showjumper.
Did you know all ponies are horses, but not all horses are ponies?
Sanskrit: सर्वे अश्वकाः अश्वाः सन्ति किन्तु सर्वे अश्वाः अश्वकाः न इति ज्ञायते वा?

English: For ponies are horses that are 1.5 metres high at the base of the neck.
Sanskrit: अश्वकाः तु कण्ठस्य अधोभागे केवलं एकदशमलवपञ्चमिति-पर्यन्तम् उन्नताः वर्तन्ते।

English: The magic glasses.
The old man and his goat lived in the outskirts of a village.
Sanskrit: वृद्धः, तस्य अजः कस्यचन ग्रामस्य अन्ते निवासं कृतवन्तौ।

English: One day -
The glare from the sun is getting too much for my old eyes.
I need a pair of dark glasses.
The next morning-
What kind would you like? Brown or Green?
Sanskrit: कः वर्णः आवश्यकः? पिङ्गलो वा हरितो वा?

English: Let me try both.
AAH! This green pair is really soothing. I'll take it.
Sanskrit: हाऽऽऽ! हरित-उपनेत्रम् बहु सुखकारि एव। क्रीणामि।

English: Right.
Back home -
See me new glasses?
Oh, but you must be hungry.
I'll cut some grass for you.
Soon -
Here-some lovely fresh grass.
What? Not eating? Let me see...
Oh, oh! The grass is dry.
Put on my glasses..
See? The grass is now green and fresh!
Sanskrit: पश्यसि वा? अधुना घासः हरितः प्रत्यग्रः च!

English: Aren't they wonderful glasses!
This happened to me...
I used to go to school by bus.
One day I lost my mathematical instruments box.
Only the compass was left with me as I was using it at that time.
Sanskrit: केवलं वृत्तिनिर्माता एव शेषः यतोहि तेन कार्यम् कुर्वन् अस्मि।

English: While travelling in the bus, I carelessly scratched my name on the rear of the seat in front of me.
Sanskrit: लोकयाने प्रयान-समये विना चिन्तनेन अग्रासन्दस्य पृष्ठे मम नाम उत्कीर्णम् कृतं मया।

English: The next day I happened to sit on the same seat in the same bus.
Sanskrit: अग्रिमे दिवसे तस्य एव लोक-यानस्य तस्मिन् एव आसन्दे पुनः उपविष्टवान्।

English: I was shocked to notice that somebody had scratched, "..is a bad boy" after my name!
Sanskrit: जडीभूतः अभवम् यदा मया दृष्टं यत् मम नाम्नः अनन्तरं 'दुष्टः बालः' इति उत्कीर्णमासीत्।

English: From that day I stopped scratching my name on the rear of seats!
Sanskrit: तद् दिवसात् पश्चात् आसन्द-पृष्ठेषु नाम-लेखनं त्यक्तं मया।

English: This true-life story has been sent by Narendra Kumar Mittal of Mysore.
Find the missing numbers.
Which barrel is different?
What is the major mistake in this picture of the Quit India Movement of 1942?
Sanskrit: द्विचत्वारिंशदुत्तरोनविंशतिशत-तमस्य वर्षस्य "त्यजन्तु भारतम्" आन्दोलनस्य अस्मिन् चित्रे प्रधान-दोषः कः?

English: Self-inflating balloon
You will need: sugar, dry yeast, a balloon, a long bottle and string.
Sanskrit: आवश्यकानि - शर्करा, शुष्क-प्रकिण्वं, दीर्घ-रिक्त-कूपी, तन्तुः च।

English: Dissolve five spoonfuls of sugar in a cup of water.
Pour this solution into a clear bottle.
Now mix one spoonful of yeast and two spoonfuls of water and pour this mixture into the bottle containing the sugar solution.
Sanskrit: अधुना शर्कर-क्वाथ-युक्त-कूप्याम् एकचमसमित-प्रकिण्वस्य द्विचमसमित-जलस्य च मिश्रणं योजितव्यम्।

English: Now fix a balloon tightly to the neck of the bottle and tie a string round it.
Put this bottle in a warm place. After some time the balloon will get inflated.
Sanskrit: उष्ण-स्थाने कूपी इयं स्थापितव्या। किञ्चित् समयानन्तरं वागोलः फुल्लिष्यति।

English: This is because the yeast breaks down the sugar to release carbon dioxide gas which inflates the balloon.
Sanskrit: यतोहि शर्करायाः विघटनात् अङ्गाराम्लवायोः उत्सर्गः भवति येन वागोलः फुल्लति।

English: Scissors, curved rule, needle, thimble. reel belong to tailor
Saw, screwdriver, hammer, file belong to carpenter
Judge's wig, Soldieös helmet, Cadet's cap
Arab's headdress, Baker's (chef's) cap
A LEAKY TALE
LET'S HOPE we HAVE a good day's fishing.
What a glorious day!
WHAT'S THAT? I didn't KNOW WE HAD A FOUNTAIN ON BOARD.
Sanskrit: किम् इदम्? नौकायां जलाकरः अस्ति इति न ज्ञातम् मया।

English: THE BOAT'S SPRUNG a LEAk, you Fool!
What shall we do?
I have it! We'll make ANOTHER HOLE SO THaT THE WATER will FLOW out OF THAT!
Sanskrit: अन्यं चेदं करिष्यावः जलं तेन चेदेन निस्स्रविष्यति।

English: A brilliant idea.

Sanskrit: अग्रे किम् जनिष्यते? द्विशत-शब्देषु वा न्यून-संख्याके वा कथां पूरयतु तथा पञ्चाशीत्युत्तर-नवदश-शततमे वर्षे जुलैमासस्य विंशद्-दिनाङ्कस्य पर्यन्तं प्रेषयितुं शक्यते। सर्वोत्तम-लेखनाय पञ्चाशत् रूप्यकाणि। त्रिभ्यः पञ्चविंशद्-रूप्यक-मूल्यात्मकाः सान्त्वना-पुरस्काराः अपि दास्यन्ते।

English: One day a professor was travelling by train, WHEN---
Sanskrit: यदा कश्चन प्राध्यापकः लोहपथयानेन कुर्वन् अस्ति --

English: Your tickets, please.
Dear, oh, dear - where is my ticket?
Ticket please.
I'm sorry. I SEEM TO HAVE misplACED my TICkET.
Sanskrit: क्षम्यताम्। मम चीटिका कुत्र स्थापिता इति विस्मृतम्।

English: Well, all right. You seem to be an honest and respectable man. I am sure you must have bought your ticket.
Sanskrit: अस्तु। भवान् विश्वासी सज्जनः च इव दृश्यते। चीटिकां विक्रीतवान् इति मन्ये अहम्।

English: Yes, I did. But you see, I have to find it!
But I've told you that it's all right by me.
Sanskrit: किन्तु कथितं किल मया यत् समस्या नास्ति।

English: But you don't understand.
If I don't find it, how will I know at which station to get off?
Sanskrit: अन्विष्टुं न शक्नोमि चेत् कुत्र उत्तराणि इति कथं ज्ञास्यामि?

English: TRE BOAT RACe OF ernakulam, Kerala was about to begin.
Look. They are all lined up.
It will start any minute now.
Hurray! Here they go.
Those two are neck-and-neck.
Friend could you lend me a box of matches.
Eh..? Sure.
Come on! Faster! Faster!
It will be a close finish.
Look! That man has jumped in.
Hey! Everyone's forgotten the boat race.
Naturally - see this man has done such a fine deed saving the other fellow.
Sanskrit: अवश्यमेव! अन्यस्य प्राणरक्षां कृत्वा उत्तमकार्यं कृतवान्।

English: My boy! Well done! This man must be your relative.
Sanskrit: साधु वत्स, साधु! बन्धुः वा तव?

English: Relative? I've never seen him before.
Bravo! Yet you jumped in so promptly after him.
Sanskrit: साधु! तथापि तम् अनुसृत्य सत्वरं कूर्दितवान्।

English: Naturally. He had my box of matches.
Sanskrit: अवश्येमव! मम अग्निपेटिका तस्य पार्श्वे आसीत्।

English: One more victim.
One evening, on a busy street.
Hot news!
One boy dupes 57 persons.
57 duped by one boy. Single-handedly.
Sanskrit: एककिनः बालस्य द्वारा एव सप्त-पञ्चाशज्-जनानां वञ्चना।

English: Come here, boy! How much for that paper?
Sanskrit: बाल, इह आगच्छ! वार्तापत्रस्य कृते कियन्ति रूप्यकाणि?

English: One Rupee, sir.
Breaking the sound barrier.
When man first attempted flight he did so on machines like this one built by the wright brothers.
Sanskrit: यदा मनुष्यः प्रथमवारम् उड्डयनं प्रयततवान्, सः ईदृशानां यन्त्राणां द्वारा कृतवान् येषां निर्माणं व्रैट्-भ्रातृभ्यां कृतम्।

English: The early aeroplanes were crude machines.
Today's aeroplanes however are sleek.
At first, aeroplanes were driven by propellers and travelled at low speeds.
Sanskrit: आदौ, विमानानि प्रपेलकानां द्वारा निम्नवेगेन चालितानि आसन्।

English: But with the advent of the jet engine, aircraft can be made to fly faster and faster.
Sanskrit: किन्तु क्षिपप्रणोदन-यन्त्रस्य आविष्करणेन विमानानि इतोऽपि वेगेन चलितुम् शक्नुवन्ति।

English: Today we have aeroplanes which can fly faster than even the speed of sound.
Sanskrit: अद्य विमानानि सन्ति यानि ध्वनि-वेगात् अपि शीघ्रतया उड्डयितुम् शक्नुवन्ति।

English: Sound travels at the speed of 1216 kmph, approximately, in air.
Sanskrit: वायौ ध्वनिः प्रतिहोरां प्रायः षोडशोत्तरद्वादश-किलोमिति-वेगेन गच्छति।

English: Such aeroplanes are known as supersonic aeroplanes.
Most of them are used by the military.
Now let us see what happens when an aeroplane tries to move faster than the speed of sound.
Sanskrit: यदा विमानं ध्वनि-वेगात् शीघ्रतया चलति तदा किं जायते इति अधुना दृश्यतामेव।

English: This is a sepecat jaguar of the Indian Air Force taking off.
The jaguar has a top speed of 1920 kmph.
Soon the pilot climbs to a height of 5000 metres.
He pushes forward the throttle (speed controll) levers and the aeroplane goes faster and faster.
Sanskrit: वेग-नियन्त्रण-यष्टिम् अग्रे नुत्त्वा विमानम् इतोऽपि वेगेन चालयति।

English: When the aircraft moves, it pushes the air in front of it.
Sanskrit: यदा विमानं चलति तदा अग्रे वायुं नुदति।

English: The air moves away from the plane but it cannot move faster than the speed of sound.
Sanskrit: वायुः विमानात् अपसरति किन्तु ध्वनि-वेगात् शीघ्रतया न चलितुं शक्नोति।

English: So when the plane approaches the speed of sound, the air can no longer move away and it forms a wall in front. This is called the sound barrier.
Sanskrit: यदा विमानं ध्वनि-वेगं प्राप्नोति तदा वायुः अपसर्तुं न शक्त्वा भित्तिं निर्माति। ध्वनि-भित्ति इति उच्यते।

English: The aircraft pushes its way through this wall of air. There is a loud bang as it does so. This is called a sonic boom. Now the aeroplane is travelling faster than the speed of sound.
But the aircraft leaves behind waves of compressed air. These waves can shatter window-panes if the aircraft breaks the sound barrier at too low a height.
Sanskrit: किन्तु विमानस्य पृष्ठे सङ्कुचितवायोः तरङ्गाः अवशिष्यन्ते। इमे तरङ्गाः वातायनकाचं भङ्क्तुं शक्नुवन्ति यदि विमानम् अति-न्यूनौन्नत्ये ध्वनि-बन्धकम् भनक्ति।

English: Here are some aeroplanes which can travel faster than the speed of sound.
Sanskrit: अत्र कानिचन विमानानि सन्ति यानि ध्वनिवेगात् शीघ्रतया चलितुं शक्नुवन्ति।

English: Partho's joke.
One evening partho entered a crowded restaurant.
Sanskrit: कस्मिञ्चन सायङ्काले पार्थः कस्मिञ्चित् भोजनालये आगतवान्।

English: Waiter! Bring me a plate of chicken biryani.
Sanskrit: परिवेषक! कुक्कुटमांसौदनेन पूरिताम् एकां स्थालिकाम् आनयतु।

English: Yes, sir.
Good.
Gentlemen! When Partho eats Biryani, everyone eats Biryani!
Sanskrit: सज्जनाः! यदा पार्थः मांसौदनं खादति, प्रत्येकः मांसौदनं खादति!

English: Yeah! Free biryani.
How generous of him!
Waiter, bring me a plate quickly.
Sanskrit: परिवेषक! मह्यम् एकां स्थालिकां सत्वरम् आनायतु!

English: Me, too!
Delicious!
And now, gentlemen, when partho pays his own bill, everyone pays his own bill!!
Sanskrit: अस्तु, सज्जनाः! यदा पार्थः स्वीय-देयकस्य धनसमर्पणं करोति प्रत्येकः स्वीय-देयकस्य धनसमर्पणं करोति!

English: Raghu, why are days longer in summer.
Hey, Chamataka, look at that animal run!
Sanskrit: भोः चमटकः पश्य कथं सः जन्तुः धावति!

English: We should make friends with him. Anyone who can run so fast will be useful to us.
Sanskrit: तेन सह मित्रता कर्तव्या। कोऽपि ईयत् शीघ्रम् धावति चेत् तेन आवयोः प्रयोजनम् भविष्यति।

English: Hey, friend, come here. Who are you, and what is your name?
Sanskrit: भोः मित्र, इह आगच्छ। त्वं कः? नाम किम्?

English: I'm a cheetah, the fastest animal in the world. My name's chirta.
Sanskrit: अहं चित्रकः विश्वस्य शीघ्रतमः जन्तुः। नाम चिरुतः।

English: Hear that doob doob? He could catch rabbits and even deer for us.
Sanskrit: श्रुतं वा व्रुडव्रुड? तेन अस्मत्कृते शशान् अपिच मृगान् गृहीतुं शक्यते।

English: Deer, did you say?
Yes, there are a lot of animals in this forest. But they are too fast for us. You could catch them easily enough.
Sanskrit: आम्! अस्मिन् वने जन्तवः बहवः एव। किन्तु ते अस्मत्तः वेगेन धावन्ति। त्वं तु तान् सरलतया गृहीतुं समर्थः।

English: So that is their game. But I will fix them.
Sanskrit: इयं वा तेषां नूतन-खेला! किन्तु अहं पाठयामि।

English: See that crow? He is a friend of the animals and our greatest enemy. he has foiled all our plans. He could foil this one too.
Sanskrit: सः काकः दृश्यते वा? सः जन्तूनां मित्र अस्माकं परम-शत्रुः। सः अस्माकं पूर्व-योजनाः भग्नवान्। इमां योजनाम् अपि भङ्क्तुं शक्यते तेन।

English: Leave him to me.
Well, off you go then.
Hmm. There is that pit dug by hunters. They have covered it up. I wonder.
Sanskrit: अहो! आखेटकैः निर्मितं खातम्। आच्छादितमपि। प्रयोजकं वा?

English: I will land on the pit.
There he is. He looks like a duffer. I will creep up and close and then.
Sanskrit: अत्र सः। मूर्खः इव दृश्यते। सृप्त्वा सामीपे गमिष्यामि।

English: CHARGE
Got you!
Not so fast, my friend.
Help! I am falling.
Your friends tricked you. You are trapped. Soon the hunters will come.
Sanskrit: तव मित्रैः त्वं वञ्चितः। जाले पतितः त्वम्। अचिरात् आखेटकाः आगमिष्यन्ति।

English: Please get me out. I do not want to end up in a zoo. I beg you. I won't hunt any of your friends. I give you my word.
Sanskrit: माम् इतः निष्कासय। मृगशालां न गन्तुम् इच्छामि। प्रार्थयामि एव। तव मित्राणाम् आखेटनं न करिष्यामि। प्रतिज्ञां करोमि।

English: Er..brother elephant..Could you put that log in the pit?
Sanskrit: भोः गज- भ्रातः! खाते काष्ठखण्डं स्थापय।

English: There. That is done it.
I say. Thanks a lot.
Now remember your promise.
Yes, of course. But first there is something I have to do.
Sanskrit: आम्! अवश्यमेव! किन्तु तत्पूर्वं किञ्चित् करणीयं मया।

English: Well, chirta must have finished Kalia off by now. Let us go and see.
Sanskrit: अस्तु! इदानीं पर्यन्तं तु अवश्यमेव कालियः चिरुतेन हतः स्यात्। आगच्छ पश्याव।

English: Take that! You tricked me.

Cut out tuffy's body and head out of cardboard as shown. Cover the head and body with green velvet paper using adhesive.
Sanskrit: यथा दर्शितं टफेः शरीरस्य शिरसः च आकार-कर्तनं स्थूलकागदात् कर्तव्यम्। स्याण-द्रव्यम् उपयुज्य शिरसः शरीरस्य आछादनं हरित-मृदुक-कागदेन कर्तव्यम्।

English: Cut out four feet and tail out of the cardboard as shown. Cover with green velvet paper. Stick head, body, feet and tail together to form tuffy.
Sanskrit: यथा दर्शितं चतुष्पादानां पुच्छस्य च आकार-कर्तनं स्थूलकागदात् कर्तव्यम्। हरित-मृदुक-कागदेन आछादनं कर्तव्यम्। शिरः, शरीरं, पादानि पुच्छं च परस्परम् आश्लेषणीयानि।

English: On yellow chart paper make a timetable as shown. For names of the days, use an old calendar.
Sanskrit: यथा दर्शितम् पीत-स्फोरकपत्रे समयसारिण्याः निर्माणं कर्तव्यम्। दिवस-नाम्नां कृते पुरातन-दिनदर्शिका उपयुज्या।

English: From yellow chart paper, cut out Tuffy's eyes. 12 claws and 8 scales (4 of each type). Decorate Tuffy's face, feet and body as shown.
Sanskrit: पीत-स्फोरकपत्रात् टफ़ेः नेत्रयोः, द्वादश-नखानाम्, अष्ट-शकलेषु प्रत्येक-प्रकारस्य चतुर्णाम् च आकाराः कर्तनीयाः। यथा दर्शितम् टफ़ेः मुखं, पादानि शरीरं च अलङ्करणीयानि।

English: Cut a cigarette packet into 2 halves and cover with green velvet paper. Cut out names of days, months and dates from calendar and stick on chart paper. Pieces of 3" x 15" for day and date and 4" x 15" for months.
धूमवर्ति-पेटिका भागद्वये कर्तनीया हरित-मृदुक-कागदेन आच्छादनीया। दिवस-मास-दिनाङ्क-नामानि दिनदर्शिकातः कर्तनीयानि तथा च स्फोरकपत्रे आश्लेषणीयानि। दिवसाय 3" x 15" खण्डानि। मासाय 4" x 15" खण्डानि।
Put 4 photo corners on tuffy's body and insert timetable. Stick cigarette pack halves on the sides and arrange days, dates and months in them.
Sanskrit: भावचित्र-धारक-कोणाः टफ़ेः शरीरे स्थापनीयाः तथा च समय-सारिणी न्यसनीया। धूमवर्ति-पेटिकायाः अर्धभागौ पक्षयोः आश्लेषनीयौ तथा च दिवसाः, दिनाङ्काः, मासाः च तयोः भागयोः न्यसनीयाः।

English: Stick silk cord loop behind tuffy's body as shown. Cover the reverse side of tuffy's body with brown paper.
Sanskrit: यथा दर्शितम् टफेः शरीरस्य पृष्ठभागे कौशेय-तन्तु-वर्तुलम् आश्लेषनीयम्। टफेः शरीरस्य पृष्ठभागः पिङ्गल-कागदेन आच्छादनीयः।
